div.l: This Miller smyleth · at theyr nycetee
And thought al this nys don · but for a wile
They weene that noman · may hem be guyle
But bi my thrift · yit shal I blere theyr eye
For al the sleight · in theyr philosophie
The more qweynt crekes · that they make
The more wil I steele · whan I take
In stede of floure · yit wil I yeve hem bran
The grettest clerk · is nat the wisest man
As whilom to the wolf · thus spak the mare
Of al theyr art · compte I nat a tare
Out at the dore · he goth ful prively
Whanne he saw his tyme · softly
He loked vp and doun̄ · til he had found
The clerkis hors · ther as he stoode I bound
Be hynd the Mille · vnder a levesell
And to the hors he goth hym faire and well
He stripith of the bridel · and that Anon
And whan the hors was loose · he gan gon
Toward the fenne · ther wield mares renne
And furth with wyghhe · thurgh thykke and thurgh thynne
This Miller comth In agayn · no word he saide
But doeth his note · and with the clerkis plaide
Til that theyr corn was wele and faire I ground
And whan the mele · was sakked and I bound
This Iohn goth out · and fynt his hors away
And gan to crye harrow · and weleaway
Oure hors is lost Alayn for goddis bones
Step on thy feete · com out man atones
